content.1: I am come into my garden, my sister,
content.2: I sleep, but my heart waketh:
content.3: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?
content.4: My beloved put in his hand by the hole
content.5: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped
content.6: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself,
content.7: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.
content.8: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I
